getMultiSelectRemoveValues
The function returns a list of objects to be excluded from the value of the
multiselect attribute
.
Syntax
getMultiSelectRemoveValues
(obj, ident)
Setting
Purpose
obj
An object with a multiselect attribute.
ident
An identifier of the multiselect attribute.
The parameter can be passed as text
attribute
, text
variable
, or
text
.
Note
Adding the function is done through manual input.
The function is used only in algorithms executed when saving the corresponding profile. For example, in algorithms
when saving
, in
expressions
and
validations
.
Example
For example, in the "Subscriptions"
multiselect attribute
, a user has selected proposals for which he wants to receive newsletters. To collect statistics, it is necessary to obtain a list of proposals from which the user wants to unsubscribe.
The algorithm can take the following form:
To obtain a list of objects excluded from the "Subscriptions" attribute value, the user should use the
getMultiSelectRemoveValues
function with the following parameters:
The required object -
currentObject
.
The identifier of the "Subscriptions" attribute - "SUBSCRIPTION_ID".
Other functions used to write this algorithm.
For clarity, the excluded objects are displayed as pop-up notifications using the
sendPopUpMsg
function.
To display the names of these objects, the user needs to organize a loop using
forEach
over the received list of objects and use the
getObject
and
attrByVar
functions to obtain the names of the excluded objects.
Algorithm executing result:
